solution_line_template: When Kendra bought {num_toys} toys, she paid {num_toys}*${toy_price} = $<<{num_toys}*{toy_price}={toys_total}>>{toys_total}
Since the price of a hat is ${hat_price}, when Kendra bought {num_hats} hats, she paid {num_hats}*${hat_price} = $<<{num_hats}*{hat_price}={hats_total}>>{hats_total}
The total costs for the hats and wooden toys Kendra bought is ${toys_total}+${hats_total} = $<<{toys_total}+{hats_total}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}
From the ${bill} bill, Kendra received change worth ${bill}-${total_cost} =$<<{bill}-{total_cost}={change}>>{change}
